ivardefs.name: base
ivardefs.desc: Indicates that this operation definition is a constraining profile on the base.

ivardefs.name: code
ivardefs.desc: The name used to invoke the operation.

ivardefs.name: comment
ivardefs.desc: Additional information about how to use this operation or named query.

ivardefs.name: contact_
ivardefs.desc: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

ivardefs.name: date
ivardefs.desc: The date  (and optionally time) when the operation definition was published. The date must change if and when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the ope

ivardefs.name: description
ivardefs.desc: A free text natural language description of the operation definition from a consumer's perspective.

ivardefs.name: experimental
ivardefs.desc: A boolean value to indicate that this operation definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

ivardefs.name: idempotent
ivardefs.desc: Operations that are idempotent (see [HTTP specification definition of idempotent](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec9.html)) may be invoked by performing an HTTP GET operation instead of a POST.

ivardefs.name: instance
ivardefs.desc: Indicates whether this operation can be invoked on a particular instance of one of the given types.

ivardefs.name: jurisdiction_
ivardefs.desc: A legal or geographic region in which the operation definition is intended to be used.

ivardefs.name: kind
ivardefs.desc: Whether this is an operation or a named query.

ivardefs.name: name
ivardefs.desc: A natural language name identifying the operation definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

ivardefs.name: overload_
ivardefs.desc: Defines an appropriate combination of parameters to use when invoking this operation, to help code generators when generating overloaded parameter sets for this operation.

ivardefs.name: parameter_
ivardefs.desc: The parameters for the operation/query.

ivardefs.name: publisher
ivardefs.desc: The name of the individual or organization that published the operation definition.

ivardefs.name: purpose
ivardefs.desc: Explaination of why this operation definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

ivardefs.name: resource_
ivardefs.desc: The types on which this operation can be executed.

ivardefs.name: status
ivardefs.desc: The status of this operation definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

ivardefs.name: system
ivardefs.desc: Indicates whether this operation or named query can be invoked at the system level (e.g. without needing to choose a resource type for the context).

ivardefs.name: type
ivardefs.desc: Indicates whether this operation or named query can be invoked at the resource type level for any given resource type level (e.g. without needing to choose a specific resource id for the context).

ivardefs.name: url
ivardefs.desc: An absolute URI that is used to identify this operation definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance. This SHALL be a URL, SHOULD be globally unique, and SHOULD be an address at which this operation definition is (or w

ivardefs.name: useContext_
ivardefs.desc: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These terms may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate operation definition instances.

ivardefs.name: version
ivardefs.desc: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the operation definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the operation definition author and is not expected to be globally
